headline: Warmonger Liz Cheney complains the US has become too noninterventionist
author: admin
sentences:
Vance telling a podcast host he does not care what happens in Ukraine and Sen. Josh Hawley (R-MO) saying that the U.S. should not send troops to Ukraine to fight because it is “not in our security interest,” Cheney said isolationism has “always been wrong.”
“We’ve been down that road before,” Cheney said.

Liz Cheney took time off her Trump witch hunt to go on cBS and whine about how the US has become too noninterventionist and isolated by not wanting to go directly into a war with Russia, over Ukraine.
Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY) claimed Sunday that isolationism has always been “wrong” and “dangerous” after some public figures called for a noninterventionist strategy for the Ukraine-Russia conflict.
The same Liz Cheney who says Ukraine’s borders are sacred, has no problem that this country’s borders are wide open and dangerous terrorists are flowing in every day.
America cannot defend and maintain our own freedom and security if we think that we’re going to simply withdraw from the world and not lead.”
The warmongers in Congress and the media are really excited about the possible war with the US and Russia.
Asked by host Margaret Brennan on CBS’s “Face the Nation” about Republican Ohio Senate candidate J.D.
“We’ve seen isolationism in both parties, and it’s always been wrong, and it’s always been dangerous.
Old wart face Liz Cheney is just auditioning for her 2023 job on CNN or MSNBC.
She’s toast come the Wyoming GOP primary.
